benchmark_details.name: POLYEVAL
benchmark_details.overview: POLYEVAL is a benchmark consisting of queries and documents collected from real-world healthcare scenarios, focusing on various medical contexts such as medical policy, hospital recommendations, and healthcare inquiries, with multiple annotations regarding timeliness and authoritativeness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a diverse and representative evaluation benchmark for retrieval-augmented generation models in medical applications.

data.source: 1,447 real-world user queries collected from a medical-related online platform in China along with 21,276 relevant documents searched from various sources including expert knowledge, online search engines, and news.
data.annotation: Annotated by human annotators, including three highly-skilled annotators for relevance, complement, and utility, with authority levels approximated from source authority.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on user query relevance and document effectiveness in answering medical inquiries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better retrieval performance and effective generation of relevant content.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluate models augmented with retrieval using public retrieval models like BM25, GTE, BGE-M3, and jina embedding.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were conducted to validate the benchmark on various tasks.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential risk of bias in the queries and documents collected impacting the performance evaluation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Patient data was collected and anonymized to maintain privacy standards.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Complies with local regulations governing medical data usage.
